topic.title: Dr. Daniel Kim: What is fungibility? The social implications of Bitcoin not having privacy & fungibility
IPFS Wrapper + Cryptocurrency Tradingview widgets
topic.body:
I have build an IPFS based Javascript web app which display multiple URLs wrapped in tabs and added some examples below. Would like to hear some feedback.


https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmeEiq5P7HimX72yqSjLTNuUQsw77T7j3xyqJckhncvucd?import=QmQfZXCadT1adLUYsQ9SjamzhpTLP2ZB2epSd3EudSqde8&title=USD-Price 

https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmeEiq5P7HimX72yqSjLTNuUQsw77T7j3xyqJckhncvucd?import=Qmash2rt2WLTp8w5uSQLAiUYbgpqdueiRSK9Ke3mnQJHDR&title=XMR-Ratios

https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmeEiq5P7HimX72yqSjLTNuUQsw77T7j3xyqJckhncvucd?import=QmPxeSZUAHb8CETPeC2Sw9usbX3HvAtaE7MjdCgWzyodrt&title=Bitfinex-LongShort-Ratios

topic.title: Cryptocurrency hashrate comparison
topic.body:
I'm currently working on another Javascript web app and put several comparisons together  including the one below to demonstrate which cryptocurrency is the most resistant to mining crackdowns in China. :)

https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmSvJGr9CGxNX8RkzwEzSM7y9FWndZvEZAY8tJxELgEzdP

topic.title: Javascript Cryptocurrency Chart app
topic.body:
Build this Javascript app which creates charts for certain cryptocurrencies based on the query arguments passed.

https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmRB6JwGWUVGuoaHciVTjBTwjWPtJjnX9jNffRYY2ZG9js

1613652791_1LqdvKDPZkkuq472J2ZdANDSd1JNK.body:
> [zeroseed4](#comment_75_1HTbdyz4zToxkxfmuYYfNVN1Y3U2yeki1N): You are the author of this vids? I can Copy all your Channel on my zite and seed It if you want

no i'm not the creator

this videos license is: Creative Commons Attribution license (reuse allowed)

Source: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8quGD9W7B2I

> [zeroseed4](#comment_76_1HTbdyz4zToxkxfmuYYfNVN1Y3U2yeki1N): Great!  I know that all vids on sites decentralized Like dtube are hosted on different nodes Like zeronet zites. All these site content because of this are copyleft?

idk if every video on dtube is allowed to be reused. If you want to reuse a video and unclear about its license you could try to identify and contact the copyright holder and ask for their permission.

> [ihaphleas](#comment_6_1PZivKEBF8sdpTRbeb9Wug8HMv3Cfvqo5A): We need to create a ZeroBazaar to be a distributed eBay (like OpenBazaar) where we can use Monero and other crypto better.

that would be really nice

> [zeroseed4](#comment_78_1HTbdyz4zToxkxfmuYYfNVN1Y3U2yeki1N): This movie on zeronet [...]

cool, thank you for this =)

1613761105_1PZivKEBF8sdpTRbeb9Wug8HMv3Cf.body:

**Official project website**

**Monero advisor Dr. Daniel Kim**
   
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFpToarIGd1mrGKwN32OexQ

**Monero Community Workgroup**

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKxLNPJeEjPXOke55i5AIXA
    
**Monero Talk**

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3Hx81QYLoEQkm3vyl4N4eQ

**Monero Outreach**

https://www.monerooutreach.org/quick-facts.html

> [rolouzis](#comment_22_16sZ53MFsJNXQGth1LUAPgbsR9K2ZtYNW2): GOLD & SILVERRest are junk when power grid is lost!

Don't forget Platinum. The Gold/Platinum ratio was 2,2 last summer. A great opportunity to rebalance from Gold to Platinum. Imo Platinum is still undervalued compared to Gold.

1610676192_1Eh9Nzq2eMP62VExTCTSyPD46aKWq.body:
> [nulap2p](#comment_4_14hM1diWaCRcVmHUZHyzoSbG3BvNnt7Yf5): You can create & access the BTC wallet anonymously via proxy. And fill it also using anonymity services (coinjoin/coin mixing, see oldest comment in this thread ).

yes, but why bother with proxy, coinjoin, mixing and Bitcoins outrageous fees to get "mixed" coins that can be distinguished from unmixed coins, that can eventually put you in trouble afterwards?

In Monero all coins are equal and they have no tx history and average fees are below 1 cent, not 15$ like in Bitcoin

1625696367_1LqdvKDPZkkuq472J2ZdANDSd1JNK.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_3139_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): The clearnet link loads, but not in Thor Browser... yet. I'm trying to seed it. [...]

Thanks for the feedback!

Have you managed to open it meanwhile? I have successfully loaded the page with up-to-date versions of Firefox, Chromium and Opera.

> [styromaniac](#comment_3140_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Yes. Half of the widgets load. The rest come up as null.

I just opened the site in Firefox on an older version of Linux in a Virtual Machine and had similar issues. Assume it depends on the Browser(version) and its HTML5 implemenation, and also on how many widgets are opened simultaneously. Thanks again.

> [styromaniac]

Thanks again for all the feedback.

I reopened the page and had no issues. Keep in mind that the current URL is an unfinished app and takes a widely used up-to-date Browser and a working gateway for granted.

> [styromaniac](#comment_3144_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): The problem is that the error was on Firefox for Linux. My software is up to date. That wasn't from Thor Browser. Also, it was requested via IPFS protocol with a working node locally. [...]

Ah, you are requesting it from the a custom protocol. Didn't know that.

Yeah, the current version assumes it is being called via http(s) and having an /ipfs/ prefix in its path. Has to be updated.


Does it work when you request the widgets directly?

ipfs://QmX7P35rjG3PdxqtRN6MRUy345nwfLLVy3TbT1PxywNY1A/?data=fees&currency=xmr&year=2021

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_1060_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): it took a while to load some graphs,

Loading can in certain situations take a while, when the data to display is too large for example. Because everything like downloading, file parsing etc. is done client side. The sample link posted loads a lot of data simultaneously.

> Firefox developer console (F12 key) shown Uncaught RangeError: invalid or out-of-range index

I'm getting that error as well. It does however not seem to effect the end result....

> "503 Service Temporarily Unavailableopenresty" on some.

That message is coming from the gateway. Reloading the page/iframe might help :)

1626699366_1LqdvKDPZkkuq472J2ZdANDSd1JNK.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_3157_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): You need to set the viewport so mobile devices don't have a weird view.

The viewport was set actually but apparently the content was exceeding the screen. Does it look a bit better now on mobile?
